meanings.definition: An inner feeling or voice viewed as acting as a guide to the rightness or wrongness of one's behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her conscience told her it was wrong to cheat on the test.
meanings.sent2: He listened to his conscience and decided to help the injured bird.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's conscience whispered to her not to take the candy without asking.
meanings.sent4: His conscience was a strict teacher, always pointing out his mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The conscience is like a moral compass, guiding us in the right direction.

meanings.definition: The part of the mind that makes you aware of your actions as being either morally right or wrong.
meanings.sent1: When he lied, his conscience made him feel guilty.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't ignore her conscience urging her to apologize.
meanings.sent3: His conscience seemed to have a mind of its own, scolding him for every misstep.
meanings.sent4: The conscience is like a mirror reflecting our moral choices back at us.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring your conscience is like trying to silence your own moral compass.
